title: Capitolium of Verona
description: Excavations have determined the location of the capitolium of Roman Verona, part of an extensive, terraced complex that underpins medieval and later structures of the city. The capitolium itself stretches from the northern end of the modern Piazza Erbe to the via Emilei, lying beneath the Palazzo Maffei, church of San Benedetto, Palazzo Malaspina and surrounding structures.

properties.description: Location after Cavalieri Manasse 2008. Remains lie beneath subsequent structures and so are not visible on the surface.
properties.title: Imagery Location of approximate centerpoint of the capitolium of Verona
